chunks.title: SSR, SSG & ISR in Next.js  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #133.mp4
chunks.text: Today we will talk about how to fetch data in Next.js

chunks.title: SSR, SSG & ISR in Next.js  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #133.mp4
chunks.text: There are 3 ways to fetch data in Next.js

chunks.title: SSR, SSG & ISR in Next.js  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #133.mp4
chunks.text: 1. SSR which is server side rendering

chunks.title: SSR, SSG & ISR in Next.js  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #133.mp4
chunks.text: 2. SSG which is static side generation

chunks.title: SSR, SSG & ISR in Next.js  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #133.mp4
chunks.text: 3. ISR which is incremental static regeneration

chunks.title: SSR, SSG & ISR in Next.js  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #133.mp4
chunks.text: We will learn all this in detail in this video

chunks.title: SSR, SSG & ISR in Next.js  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #133.mp4
chunks.text: But don't forget to like this video and write Next.js op in the comment section below

chunks.title: SSR, SSG & ISR in Next.js  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #133.mp4

chunks.title: SSR, SSG & ISR in Next.js  Sigma Web Development Course - Tutorial #133.mp4

text: Today we will talk about how to fetch data in Next.js There are 3 ways to fetch data in Next.js 1. SSR which is server side rendering 2. SSG which is static side generation 3. ISR which is incremental static regeneration We will learn all this in detail in this video But don't forget to like this video and write Next.js op in the comment section below Let's go to the computer screen Let's roll the intro So guys this is my web dev folder in which I will create a folder named video133 And I will create a new Next.js app I will open the terminal by right clicking And in the terminal I will create the same command Next app latest And I will name this app SSR ISG ISR I will tell you what is this now Type script no ESLint yes Tailwinds CSS yes SRC no App router yes And we will not change the import alias So let's talk about what is this now I will open my Next.js app and show you I will be able to open it like npm run dev And see here this is a very basic app This is the same app that Next.js always gives us Now I will tell you 3 concepts First concept is server side rendering Which we also call SSR What is this server side rendering So in Next.js Suppose this is our component Which is our homepage component I will remove it here I will write div and type IAM homepage And if I show you now This is how IAM homepage looks Now in this IAM homepage I do anything here That is rendering on server side Because I have not put a use client here So by default any component In Next.js is a server component So whatever I do here It will be on the server If I write here Console.log Hello And I run this app So I show you this hello is coming here Because it was reloaded And because of its reloading, this hello is being printed here So this is being printed on the server side This is our server side And this console is our client side So if I want to print this hello here So I have to write use client First By coming here So that this client will become a component So what I will do I will edit its readme So I will write here first about SSR I will write here SSR So what is SSR SSR is server side rendering So I close it and write it here SSR is server side rendering Server side rendering means Things are being rendered on the server And this is default behavior So I will write here This is default behavior After this, the second thing is SSG And this is static site generation Now what is this SSG Look server side rendering is by default Now you will do any fetch here You will hit any request here That request will go It will go through the server side It will not go through the client side Because this is your server component Now let's talk about SSG Which is static site generation Now how does this happen Now what used to happen These terms Generation These terms were popular when pages router was very popular Next year there was no app router Everything was done through pages router And what used to happen in this SSR was done using get static props type functions But These functions do not work after app router So this app router gets Server side props type function That will not work Yes in next year's version 14 or 15 You can use pages router Now let's talk about static site generation What is static site generation Static site generation means When you build a page Then it will be built statically Or it will be a part of the server side What does it mean Look once you develop your app So what happens Once you develop your app Then Your app will be built Before deploying And in this way you build next npm run Which internally Runs next build See it is running next build And it is making an optimized production build So you can see here It is making an optimized production build It is taking time, it is compiled successfully Now look it is generating static pages It has generated 5 static pages Which static pages One not found One slash This is static page Pre rendered as static content Why? To optimize delivery Now next year's thought There is nothing in this page Which i can run on server side Why not i build it beforehand So that it does not need to be built again and again Because if there was a network call Because of which It would have been necessary to build it again and again So maybe it would have made sense to build it again and again So it has been pre rendered as static content So in your production build In that You will be shown this page as a static content And this is our static site generation So any content Which does not have Network calls Is a static page By default So this is also done by default Now we talk Incremental site Generation Is also called ISG Or Incremental static regeneration Isr Incremental static regeneration What is this? Now understand the point There is going to be a twist in the story We have seen what is server side rendering It runs on the server If you have put a network call Or database call Then it will be a static page Now assume You want your page to change every 60 seconds So what happened in next.js Next.js Fetch function I will show you how the data fetching Of next.js is done Now see If you use fetch in next.js Then what will happen This is not a normal fetch function Which we use in javascript Fetch has been modified in next.js What does it mean? It means That in next.js You have used fetch And you will use the same call again Like this example I am copying it And pasting it here In fact here And see what we are doing here First we are making this function async We are saying Go to api.versal.app.block Which looks like this In the api.versal.app.block They have given a sample data Like this And now see We have taken the post And then we have mapped it And this is a very simple thing That we will see all the posts here I think I have closed the site I will run npm run dev And I will reload it again And it will run So all our blogs will be visible From this data Now if I refresh it It will be very fast And the reason for that is This network call Will not go again and again Why? Because it has gone once Now it will be cached And if it changes Then it will be like this You will see it like this If you change it Then you will see it like this Some people consider it a problem But I don't know why My reason is very simple Next.js by default Caches it Now if you want new data Then what you have to do You have to do this In next.js You have to do no store Cache and no store I will copy it You will simply do this You are telling it You are telling Fetch API run it again and again This data is going to change By default it will not run again and again For your benefit So that your network calls are saved Your server compute calls are saved Your app is optimized So api.versal.app Will get request again and again Because cache is stored If you don't want to catch the response from fetch You can do the following Now let's talk about ISR What is ISR? What you have to do You want to incrementally With time Revalidate the page Once the page is cached Now you want to revalidate it with time So you will simply do this And now what will happen It will take best of both worlds This is also not right You update your blog sometimes And you want to get my update It should not be that You didn't get it You want to get updates every time And you want to get updates every time You don't want that You will give this option Next revalidate 3600 seconds So this revalidate Is a number Which is number of seconds And here it is 3600 seconds Which is 60 minutes So in every hour Your page will be revalidated And you will get updated page Okay Now here are two exceptions Where fetch request is not cached First exception is Whenever you use fetch in server action And whenever you use it in route handler So i will write this That Fetch in Next.js Caches the response However there are exceptions And those exceptions are these Those exceptions are these What are these? So i have written exceptions here Whenever you use it in server action or in route handler In post method If you use it, it is not cached Now i will show you one thing I told you that page is pre-rendered If i do something like this On this page I will do something like this Let's see what happens by default I will build next Npm run will run So you will see that This page will be build in a static page I will show you This page is build in a static page If i do something like this Now see It is build in a static page Which means this response will not change It will be revalidated every one hour But if i add here Export const dynamic Is equal to force dynamic Then what will happen? Then it will not be rendered as a static page Let's wait for it And let's see this in action This is rendered as a dynamic page See here this slash There is an F And it is dynamic This is server rendered on demand Why? Because you told it This page will be server rendered I don't want to play this game So what you can do by writing this You can tell Don't cache my fetch request Every time Fetch this page And show me So Which rendering is this? This is server side rendering If you want to export this By default It is server side rendering But if you are using fetch Then you can use cache And if you want to opt out Then use this And here i will write To opt out Use And you can use this code I will copy and paste this So that it will be easy for you And you can see here Export const dynamic Is equal to force dynamic Let's also put semicolon However there are exceptions I have already told you So this is our server side rendering Static side generation And isr and isg Incremental static generation Or incremental static regeneration It is the same thing Now here How is the data fetching? How and when it works? You have to read it to know its caveats But let me tell you What i told you was 95% of the information And whatever you learn You can't learn more than 95% of the information Because It is a documentation 100% of the information So you can go to the documentation You can read it You will understand You can learn more about data fetching If you want to master it Otherwise, use the rule of thumb If your page is not being re-rendered Then you need to use this If you want to fetch new data Then you need to use this I hope you liked this video And you understood What is ssr, ssg and isg Thank you so much guys For watching this video And i will see you next time Outro
